intro: Senecio fremontii subsp. blitoides, commonly known as the Fremont's senecio, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has adapted to thrive in dry conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green, covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a dense cluster. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats.
